name: Menaggio Youth Hostel La Primula

reviews.text: My family and I spent few days in Menaggio. We decided to go for a full morning cooking class at La Primula Hostel .It was a fun and enjoyable experience.My boys (7 & 14 ) had a god time learning to prepare a Real Pesto and a Tiramisu. After the class, the whole group seat at the terrace to enjoy all what we cooked. It was lovely ! and the view breathtaking !
reviews.title: Great vibe,great cooking class,friendly people.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and the atmosphere very relax and also child friendly.next time ,we are planing to sleep over at the Hostel.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.text: We found this place by pure coincidence and really enjoyed the stay. It has a great view overseeing the lake from the terrace and a real "backpacker" feeling to it. We stayed in a private double which were bunk beds but the room was OK and the bathrooms were reasonably clean. The best things about it was the food: We got the 2-course meals and they were really great. Furthermore, beer and wine are super cheap and the staff is very friendly. Definitely recommended if you are looking for a reasonably priced accommodation. Only "downsides" were 1.) that it got quite hot in the rooms (but they had a fan) and 2.) that people tend to stay on the terrace till late at night and it can get a bit noisy.
reviews.title: Fab place, fab views, fab friendly staff

reviews.text: Amazing hostel with a relaxed family friendly feel. Friendly, helpful staff, lovely CLEAN rooms and AMAZING views of the mountains and lakes at a reasonable price. Thank you so much everyone at La Primula for being so kind and friendly to us and our children. We hope to come back one day soon.
reviews.title: Great hostel

reviews.text: Stayed here for a few nights in June 2011. It is a hostel-so yes, there are people sharing a room, and yes, the rooms are sometimes small. But, despite being basic, they have everything you need-lock-able storage, fairly comfy beds, working showers. I found the staff to be helpful and very accommodating-and the food, especially the pizzas, were good value and incredibly tasty! Thoroughly recommended. The hostel does tend to attract a younger crowd so bringing ear-plugs if you are a light sleeper is a good idea-but if you join in and have a few drinks with the staff and others you will have a great time! The hostel is well located and has its own beach (albeit small). Having to pay for WIFI is a bit of a pain though-but overall a great hostel and I will definitely be returning!
reviews.title: Personal agradable y un sitio estupendo

reviews.text: Hostels are one of the best places to meet people when you're traveling, but the manager was a jerk, who seems to think that bluntness and rudeness are a good way to speak to people(All backpackers are not beer-swilling)
reviews.title: Non me piace!

reviews.text: Reception is not 24 hours and doors are closed in the afternoon, so we cannot rest after long day of travel.
reviews.title: Not recommended!

reviews.text: You're not allowed to use the kitchen for cooking. Cannot use fridge, cannot use microwave.That's ridiculous!
reviews.title: How to experience exquisite Menaggio at fun, friendly, and affordable lodgings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very average place to stay! They should not put 4 people in a 4 bed room when they are not fully booked! One of the staff is rude and seems like it is an effort to respond to questions you ask him! The showers are unreliable as well!
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent three days at the hostel, a non profit, and the only one of its kind in the area. The food was terrific but we loved the most was the expert kayaking instruction our daughters received from Valentina, the friendly and skilled staff person that doubles for Italian lessons and Kayaking. They had a wonderful time. Stay if you can find the room- off season is easier of course but if you book well in advance you will have one of the best situations in town and the price is unbeatable. Oh- and they have a private beach right beneath the hostel!
reviews.title: Great for the Price, Very Nice Spot
Maybe it was the off-season?
reviews.text: Menaggio and Lake Como are lovely and I would gladly stay there again. La Primula was in a good location overlooking the lake. The family room we had was very basic and the attached toilet/shower was miniscule but this was not really a big deal since we were not here to lounge around the 'hotel'. I was surprised to read good reviews about breakfast since ours was extremely spartan to say the least - a cold, small croissant with a (decent) cup of coffee - the atmosphere was enhanced by the mix of company sharing travel stories. Contrary to the information provided on the website NO evening meal was available at the time we stayed. The most helpful and friendly staff member happened to be a young Aussie guy who had returned to work at the hostel for free room and board - he was very welcoming and really seemed to be running the place by himself but without him I found the other permanent members of staff to be less than accommodating. I think the website gives a better impression than the reality!! We have since heard of self catering apartments in Menaggio or across the lake in the gorgeous town of Bellagio which seem to have slightly more expensive but better accommodation. Cheap doesn't always equate with satisfying.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: This hostel is in a great location, with views of Lake Como from the room, and everything within easy walking distance (ferry, bus stops, supermarket). Great value for money, although the rooms are not huge. Although it is an hostel, there are not great kitchen facilities. There is a fridge, and two microwaves, but that is about it. They are willing to give you plates and cutlery though, and have some good recommendations for cheap pizzerias.

La Primula is one of the friendliest hostels I've encountered and I had a great stay there. However, this place is definitely a hostel (not a budget hotel or guesthouse) so I can't say I think it's for everyone.
reviews.title: Great deal, great food but not for everyone.

reviews.text: The pros: The location is fabulous and easy to reach. From Milan you take a train to Varenna, where you catch one of the many ferries across the lake to Menaggio. While Menaggio itself has lovely sights nearby (ie: Villa Carlotta), the excellent ferry system also allows you to hop from Menaggio to Bellagio and Varenna quite easily. The price is right--14 Euros a night for a stay in the dorm. The staff/owners are so friendly and helpful if you need any ideas for what to do. The food is fabulous. A basic breakfast (yogurt, juice, bread) is included in the price AND they make you your own espresso drink to order--what a great way to start the day! Dinner is the real star. For 12 Euros you get wine (or soda or bottled water), pasta, meat (or fish--we there during Lent), and dessert. This was some of the best food we ate during our stay in Italy and that is saying a lot. They even accomodate vegetarians! One night when the chef came out one table began applauding him--of course we all joined in to give him well-deserved credit. Dinner is also a great time to meet some of your fellow travelers. You need to sign up by 4 pm but when we arrived on our first night at 5 pm, she told us they could still fit us in for dinner--so sweet!
reviews.title: Dolce fa niente

reviews.text: I had a great time at this hostel and I am glad I stayed there. The folk who work there could not be more helpful and friendly. Over the weekend where was a fantastic atmosphere. I was in Lake Como cycling and I was a bit reluctant to stay in a hostel as I am no 'youth'; but actually there was a great age mix and it was more than fine. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. I hate to say anything negative, as I really had a good time, but the food was not great. My impression from other reviews and the hostel's website is that it is a foody place but I did not enjoy it, apart from the pizza! The hostel overlooks the lake and is a few mins walk from the ferry and the town. The private beach is tiny but more than adequate and welcome. Stay here. PS: if you are looking for cycling routes contact me, I found an excellent one to Lugano in Switzerland.
reviews.title: Perfect location, fantastic staff, spacious dorms.

reviews.text: I was quite pleased with this hostel. The staff were really nice and helpful, there's a stunning view of the lake, and the hostel provides a range of activities you can take part in. It's right near the ferry dock and there's a small supermarket nearby too. There is a free breakfast but it's just juice, tea, coffee and bread with spreads. The wifi is really expensive which I didnt like. My room was a 4 bed female dorm and I found it fine. One thing I didnt like was the showers. Not sure about the male showers but the female shower room had very little privacy. There are 3 cubicles but no room to change so you have to change outside the cubicles, then the cubicles themselves have semi-transparent doors. The hostel provides dinner each night for a cheaper price (apparently) than most places in Menaggio, and the food is pretty good. Also lots of chances to get to know other travellers. I found Menaggio a good base for visiting Varenna, Bellagio, Como and Lake Lugano. I would probably stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location, great staff

reviews.text: What a treasure. Amazing views from this lakeside hostel. Helpful staff, rentable good bikes,clean dorm rooms.I'l be back asap, thank you.
reviews.title: lake como jewel

reviews.text: What an awesome location!! Near the ferry wharf at Menaggio and with amazing views over Lake Como, this hostel is set to please. The rooms are a little dated and have a closing down time during the day for cleaning, but with an exceptional location, there's so much to do in the surrdounding area.
reviews.title: Amazing location, great prices and lots to do

reviews.text: The restaurant/outdoor area has magnificent views over the lake, and there are some great meal packages available (plus great cheap vino). Phillippo the owner always wanders around and is genuinely interested in how people are enjoying their stay.
reviews.title: in terms of hostel very good option

aka: Menaggio Youth Hostel La Primula Hotel Menaggio
